fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27122].
  {panel}

It seems there are two options for when JIRA gets an email at a monitored mailbox from an unrecognized address: create a new user, or report through a default issue creator user.

We were hoping to to use JIRA for external support as well as internal bug tracking, but we now see it's not really possible.

With the first option, lots and lots of users get created. Our 5-person company has hundreds of customers. We simply cannot justify an $8000, unlimited license when in reality, only 5 people will be using JIRA on a regular basis, and the rest of the external customers will probably only once use it or twice when they have issues with our software.

We had some hope that, when we exceed our license limit, the users are still created, but without 'jira-users' and can't login or get notifications unless the entire project is public with browser permission, etc. This is also unacceptable, since a user could view another user's support request simply by playing with the issue number!

With the second option, it's impossible to correspond with the reporting users through JIRA. (We see that JIRA5rc3 now adds a line indicating the address the issue was recved from even if it was created by anonymous). This is useful info. But it's impossible to communicate with them over JIRA and have a record of the support ticket in this case because the notifications only go to the default issue creator, not the reporter.

If you are going to advertise the dual use of JIRA, you should have a permissions scheme that reflects this so that my 5-person company doesn't need to buy an unlimited license to use it as support. (There are MUCH CHEAPER support tools out there, but we were attracted by the concept of using a single product for both support and bug tracking).

How about splitting it up so that you have a jira-staff permission, and a jira-customer permission? With a n-person license, you can have up to n jira-staff (who can log in, send and recv notifications, create and update any issue, etc), and unlimited jira-customers (who can log in, but only view and comment on issues they have created, etc).

This would make JIRA so much better, would make your marketing less misleading, and make the licensing model better match this use case.

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user 'ADMIN' in Crowd
# Login to JIRA with the user 'ADMIN' from Crowd
# Make sure that the username is uppercase 'ADMIN' in the User Profile
# Create a ticket 
# The activity is not captured in the User Profile Activity Stream
# However, the activity is captured in the Project Activity Stream

*Workaround*
# Enable Lower Case Output from {{Crowd >> Application >> Option}}
# Recreate the directory in JIRA server and synchronize

fields.description:
The issue type names and descriptions are not translated in REST. Steps to reproduce:
* translate JIRA as per [this documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Translating+Resolutions,+Priorities,+Statuses+and+Issue+Types] (e.g. in French)
* set your user language to French
* view an issue. the issue type is translated !translation.png|thumbnail!
* view an issue through the REST API. the issue type is *not* translated (!) !rest.png|thumbnail!

This applies equally to other constants that can be translated.
fields.summary: Issue types (and other "constants") are not translated in REST

There seems to be a problem in IE8/9 and the issue view page People column breaking to the next line if required. This works on Chrome and FF.

See screenshots, to reproduce:

1. Create Custom Field type Group Picker: 'blahblahblahblahblahblahblahblah'
2. Create Custom Field type User Picker: 'blahblahblahblahblahblahblahblah'
3. Use both Custom Fields in view screen, fill them with values of "test_long_group_name" and "test_long_user_name"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27108].
  {panel}

If I have:
# A public JIRA site with
# A project that uses a permission scheme with the *Browse Projects* project permission set to *Anyone* and
# I create an issue filter which is shared with *Everyone*

That means that anonymous people have access to this 'shared filter'.

However, if I share that 'shared filter' with:
# A JIRA user --- that user receives an email message containing a link to the filter.
# Any email address (not registered with a JIRA user) --- the recipient receives an email message containing a link to the search results, not the issue filter.

I believe in case no. 2, for consistency, the email address recipient should receive a link to the issue filter.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in behaviour when sharing anonymously accessible shared filters.

fields.description:
After opening the workflow in the Workflow Designer, the Transition-Lables of the Workflow are not loaded with the correct position.

This error can be bypassed by clicking "Load saved layout" button after opening of the designs in Workflow Designer.

Please see attachment:

* [^after-opening-designer.png]: shows a screenshot of the workflow (customized design of the jira default workflow) directly after opening the workflow in the designer.
* [^after-loading-design-manually.png]: shows a screenshot of the workflow same workflow after hitting the "load layout" button - the transtion-labels moved

PS: This is reproducible on all browsers.

Regards,
Ruchi

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27097].
  {panel}

Create custom field of type multi checkbox.
Create a screen with two tabs.
In one of the tab, add *only* the custom field of multi checkbox type.

=> when viewing issue, tabs are not displayed in view screen, other fields are displayed one below the other.
=> tabs are displayed in other screen (eg : Edit issue using the same screen)

Add another  field with multicheckbox in the second tab
=> tabs are displayed in view screen and edit issue, but multicheckbox not displayed in second tab (only other type)

See attachment
fields.summary: MultiCheckbox field not displayed in tab for ViewIssue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27095].
  {panel}

1) Set up a cloud connector link to Zendesk.
2) From a JIRA issue, create a remote link to a Zendesk ticket.

The Zendesk ticket appears as a remote link on the View Issue page, showing the ticket's summary.

!Zendesk.png!

3) In Zendesk, change the ticket summary to something else.

!NewTest.png!

In JIRA, the value doesn't update. Even after a page refresh.

!Zendesk.png!
fields.summary: Cloud Connector remote link text doesn't update when a Zendesk ticket subject changes
Customware Connector links open in a new tab

fields.description:
When creating an new issue, if you decide to switch the Issue Type or Project (at the top of new JIRA 5 create form) you loose all your entered data in the create form (i.e. Desciption, Summary, etc).

Since you can change the project/type on the fly I cannot imagine you should lose your entered data.
fields.summary: All filled in data is lost when you switch Project or Issue Type
Update Fix Version Post Function

fields.description:
Sub-Task Quick Create Form has Time Tracking Field Even Though The Time Tracking Field Is Not Added To Any Screen


Sub-task Quick Create Form has Time Tracking field even though the Time Tracking field is not added to any screen. Step to reproduce:
# create a project
# create a screen and exclude Time Tracking field from it
# use the screen in step 2 in a Screen Scheme then Issue Type Screen Scheme
# associate the Issue Type Screen Scheme to the project created in step 1
# create a parent task
# create a subtask
# create a new subtask using the Quick Create Form as shown in the screenshot NoTimeTrackingFieldAddedToScreen.png .
# click on the button Create
# the Original Estimate will not be save into the newly created subtask

The <JIRA_Install>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jpm.xml has the following configuration:
{noformat}
<key>jira.subtask.quickcreateform.fields</key>
            <default-value>summary,issuetype,assignee,timetracking</default-value>
{noformat}

So, the Quick Create Form does not respect the Screen. This causing confusion for the reporter as it is requesting for the Original Estimate. 

This is tested in JIRA 4.4.4
fields.summary: Sub-Task Quick Create Form has Time Tracking Field Even Though The Time Tracking Field Is Not Added To Any Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27088].
  {panel}

Form dialogs created in initDialogs.js do not trigger when clicked inside Tempo screens.

Chrome JS console does not report that initDialogs.js is present but JIRA.Dialogs.comment is defined.

If we manually insert the code from initDialogs.js, then the triggers work as expected. 

The workaround is to hide the links with CSS but many customers are requesting to be able to perform the actions/operations inside of Tempo. But we would rather not copy paste the code from initDialogs.js to get things working. Besides, the resource is defined in jira-global so it should be present on Tempo screens.
fields.summary: Inline form dialogs do not work in a plugin
Stop Watching all Closed Issues

fields.description:
Settings:
1) System default: (GMT+00:00) timezone.zone.utc
2) profile setting for users : JIRA default (GMT+00:00) timezone.zone.utc


Descriptions:

First Scenario:

1) When use in Mac, the date picker show the PC time which is 5:40 pm (screenshot A)
2) After change the timezone of the Mac and refresh the brower. The datepicker show the server time 9:41 am (screenshot B)
3) If open a new tab in browser, the date picker show the current PC time again which is 12:41 pm (screenshot C)

Second Scenario:

This problem only exists in Safari, but not in chrome.

1) The datepicker show the Mac time. (Screenshot 1)
2) Change the time manually after few minutes, it will show the current time change.(Screenshot 2)
fields.summary: Date Time Picker are not following the server/profile setting time
want JIRA Importers Plugin settings page back  in JIRA version 4.4.1

fields.description: The reporter field is usually prepopulated with the logged in user.  If you change the issue type, the field gets wiped, resulting in us creating lots of issues by "Anonymous"
fields.summary: Reporter field no longer prepopulated after changing issue type

fields.description:
If an issue is deleted while another user is trying to convert a second issue to a subtask of the first, the conversion wizard continually gives step 3 without any error message.

Steps:
1) User 1: convert issue B to subtask => select parent (issue A) => next
2) User 2: delete issue A
3) User 1: clicking next will continually give step 3 of the wizard (update fields) and no error message
fields.summary: Deleting parent issue while converting an issue to a subtask causes the wizard to fail silently

fields.description: When an issue screen in edit mode contains an Issue Type field, the first item in the dropdown will be an alphabetic list of all projects in the system.  This item is not selectable, but it is very distracting.
fields.summary: Issue Type dropdown includes a non-selectable line containing alphabetic list of projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27078].
  {panel}

Please copy form view on the NY Sec Master JIRA to augment the existing fields in SRDR JIRA form view..

Also, please include these two addition drop downs in SRDR form views..

Error Categories

This is to categorise the error that we are reporting. i.e. the error/defect was caused because of the following reasons

Requirement Error 
Data / Config 
Env / Infra 
Program Code 
Interface / 3rd Party 
Change Request 
Design Error 
Build /System Data Error 
Test Data Error 
Test Case Error 
Parameter Error 
Training / Process Error 
Not Classified Yet 
 

Downtime Reason

This is to categorise the downtime that we are reporting. i.e. the downtime was caused because of the following reasons

Repository Not Available 
Network failure 
Database Server Down 
Main Server down 
Hardware problem 
Desktop problem 
Waiting for Incident Fix 
Batch run delay 
Dev Env Not Available 
QA Env Not Available
fields.summary: This request is to update SRDR JIRA to reflect more details when an activity is requested/logged

fields.description:
h2.Problem
There are errors rendering dashboard and login page with IE8 (Internet Explorer), if force HTTPS redirect is enabled in web.xml:

	<security-constraint>

<url-pattern>*.js</url-pattern>
<url-pattern>*.jspa</url-pattern>

fields.description:
We have made mention in the directory configuration page that enabling nested groups in JIRA can cause performance issues. The level of slowness depends on the number of groups, users and the level of nesting. During the cause of support, we have identified that with the following statistics, JIRA is extremely slow to the extend that even viewing issues takes close to two minutes:

{noformat}
about 7000 users
about 700 groups
about 6-7 levels of nesting
most user belong to the last level of group,few belongs to higher level group.
{noformat}

Upon disabling the nested feature, JIRA becomes stable even with 100 concurrent LDAP users logged in to JIRA. The cause of the performance is attributed to the fact that permissions calculation in JIRA is very expensive and JIRA has a lot of lookups to do when users try to perform operations.

h4. Workaround for Active Directory

(i) Please refer to the workaround in CWD-2082 if using Crowd Standalone. Ensure that 'Use nested groups' is also disabled in the user directory in JIRA.

If you are using Active Directory you can eliminate this problem using filter directives to delegate the nested calculations to the Active Directory server.  This is not available for other LDAP servers.
# In JIRA, go to *System > User management > User Directories*.
# Edit the user directory that syncs with Active Directory.
# In Advanced Settings uncheck the box nested groups
# In Membership Schema Settings...
#* Change *Group Members Attribute* to "member:1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941:"
#* Change *User Membership Attribute* to "memberOf:1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941:"
#* Check the box for *Use the User Membership Attribute* ... When finding the user's group membership (in other words *check both checkboxes*)
# Save the changes
# Perform a full synchronization of the User Directory.

fields.description:
When setting up JIRA to use HTTPS according to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS , the Dashboard will occasionally fail to load on IE8 / IE9. This has been verified on 4.4.4, running JIRA on a windows box. It was easily reproducible on my box by refreshing the page in IE several times.

This is happening because the {{batch.js}} file is being truncated. When inspecting the logs ({{<JIRA_INSTALL>\logs\access_log.<date>}}) of my test environment, it appears that a key javascript resource, batch.js is being truncated:

{code}
172.20.7.39 1187x187x5 - [06/Feb/2012:19:47:27 -0800] "GET /s/en_US-64k3hp/664/1/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js HTTP/1.1" 200 552757 562 "https://172.20.9.110:8443/secure/Dashboard.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0)" "1pvk52d"
172.20.7.39 1187x547x5 - [06/Feb/2012:19:47:53 -0800] "GET /s/en_US-64k3hp/664/1/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js HTTP/1.1" 200 346904 656 "https://172.20.9.110:8443/secure/Dashboard.jspa" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0)" "1pf0uli"
{code}

(note the size of the files, 552757 vs 346904). Some caveats about the sizes:
* The bad size may vary as all we know is the connection is being prematurely terminated. 
* A bad size can also be caused if the user navigates away before the dashboard has finished loading, so ensure that the user did try to load the dashboard fully.
* Ensure that they are trying to hit the Dashboard, and not some other page when trying to verify this as batch.js is served on multiple pages and the "right" size varies.

inspection of the js contents actually delivered shows it is indeed incomplete, which is causing the javascript errors and the missing dashboard. 

There is a workaround, which involves removing redirection from HTTP to HTTPS for js resources, i.e. removing
{code}
<url-pattern>*.js</url-pattern>
{code}
from the {{web.xml}} additions described [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS#RunningJIRAoverSSLorHTTPS-RedirectingcertainpagestoHTTPS]. While this should not result in reduced functionality, note that this means javascript resources can now be accessed via http directly, e.g. {{http://localhost:8080/s/en_US-64k3hp/664/1/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js}}.

fields.description:
We're getting an unusual UI issue in JIRA.

To reproduce it, follow these steps:

# Create a filter based on a changeable property (ex. status = Open).
# Follow an issue to view it from the Issue Navigator (click the issue key or click "View Issue" from tool menu).
# Change the property that the result set is filtering on (ex. promote status to Resolved)
# Click "Return to search"

When you return to the result set, the yellow alert box will now say "null has been updated" or "undefined has been updated". This is the same alert box that normally prints messages like "ISSUE-123 has been updated" when updating the issue from the Issue Navigator.

This issue seems to be fairly harmless.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator's Alert Box Doesn't Display Issue Key When Certain Changes are Made

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27055].
  {panel}

Editing an active workflow shows the message (in blue) "This workflow is Active. You will only be able to make changes to the layout."

I had to browse through several Jira issues to end up at JRA-7661, where I then learned that this message is simply not true. Apparently, you can edit them, you just have to jump through stupid hoops for no reason: click 'create draft' at the top and then publish it. (Note also that you can't _not_ publish it!)

So, I see several issues:
- at the very very least, the message should say that you can make draft/publish
- if it's possible via the the make draft/publish, it's possible and I shouldn't be forced to go through that. Let me edit, if you want to 'make draft' and 'publish' behind the scenes, do whatever you need
- for working on a big change, the draft can be useful, but then at least I should be able to drop (aka cancel/clear/revert or whatever you want to call it) the draft!
- from the docs I see the editing a draft of an active workflow still has some limitations, so maybe these should get a message in blue too.
fields.summary: Editing active workflow is non-obvious

fields.description:
{panel}
This issue deals with how JIRA manages HTTP sessions for stateless requests to the REST/SOAP API. The related issue JRA-27050 deals with session management for web Crawlers.
{panel}

JIRA creates a session for every request that does not already belong to a session. This creates problems on servers where the REST and SOAP APIs are used extensively. 

With the REST API we encourage people to use BASIC authentication, which is supposed to be stateless. However, we end up creating a new session for each request that is authenticated with basic. This can strain the server unnecessarily.

See [JRJC-47|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JRJC-47] for a case where this has been reported. To fix this we need to make at least the following changes:
* JIRA should *not* create a new session for requests that authenticate using basic auth
* JIRA should *not* create a new session for unauthenticated REST requests
fields.summary: JIRA creates sessions for "stateless" requests

fields.description:
Steps:

1. Use Jira with 'out of the box' default settings.
2. As an admin, customize the 'default screen' and add the field 'Resolution'
**do not change the default value of Resolution, keep the default as 'fixed'.
3. Now exit administration and create a new issue. The 'Resolution' field is now present when creating a new ticket, leave the field set to its default of 'fixed'.

Outcome:

1. In the dashboard 'Activity Stream', the issue is created and 'crossed-out' (presumably since it is in a Resolution state 'fixed').
2. Click on the issue to access the 'View Ticket' screen. Observe that the 'Resolution' is set to 'Unresolved'. But also look in the section titled 'Dates' and you see 3 entries: Created, Updated, Resolved. 
3. The 'Status' is 'open', as expected.

Contradiction: 

Since the issue key is crossed out and the 'Dates' log has a 'Resolved' entry, the issue must be have a Status of 'Resolved' with resolution 'fixed'. But this contradicts the Resolution field being set to 'Unresolved' in the View Issue screen.
fields.summary: A new issue can have a Status 'Open', a Resolution state of 'Unresolved', and yet also be 'Resolved' simultaneously.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27028].
  {panel}

When performing an upgrade to the current version of the Cloud Connectors, it forgets that the admin has already accepted the licence. This breaks various functionality in the plugin for end-users until an admin logs in and accepts it again.

--------------

Setup:

1) Set up an OnDemand instance with the current Studio production version (studio-fireball-128.1).
2) Go to any Connector admin screen and accept the EULA.
3) Configure a connection to Zendesk.
4) Link a JIRA issue to a Zendesk ticket.
5) Upgrade the instance to the latest OnDemand version (studio-fireball-snapshot-nightly-r129127 in my test).

--------------

Post-Setup:

* Go to any Connector admin screen. It shows the licensing screen again:
!EULA.png!

* End-user scenario:
** Log in as a non-admin user.
** Return to the JIRA issue created before the upgrade.
** Go to the "Manage Application Links" screen (an end-user-visible screen accessible from the dot dialog or More Actions dropdown).
** Click "Pull" or "Push" to resync the issue with Zendesk.
** It fails because of the licensing issue:
!ErrorForbidden.png!

** If you're an admin, it also fails but accidentally embeds the admin screen in the page because the error message is not HTML-encoded (a possible XSS vulnerability).
!BadEULA.png!
fields.summary: On upgrade, Cloud Connectors forget that the licence has been accepted

The XML view does not shows the Full Name. Steps to replicate:
# create a User Picker field and add it to a screen
# create a new user. Let's say username="jalbion" Full Name="Janet Albion"
# create an issue and set choose "jalbion" in the User Picker type field
# go to Issue Navigator
# add User Picker type custom field to the column
# search for the issue in the Issue Navigator
# choose to view the Issue in the XML view and the XML will return username:
{noformat}
<customfields>
<customfield id="customfield_10100" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:userpicker">
<customfieldname>userpicker</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues><customfieldvalue>jalbion</customfieldvalue></customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
</customfields>
{noformat}
fields.summary: XML View Display User As Username Instead of Full Name

fields.description:
When using the REST API:
/rest/api/2/project/${key}
issueTypes is spelled with with a capital 'T'
When using the REST API:
/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta
issuetypes is spelled with a lower-case 't'

This is very annoying because GSON complains that it cannot find the Java field of my class with one of the spellings.

For the same objects, JSON should be the same.
I am quite surprised this can even happen, but I hope this is only a typo.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-27019].
  {panel}

MS SQL must be set 'READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT=ON' or there will be an error:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Upgrade+to+4.4+on+MS-SQL+times+out

It is not stated in the 'Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2008' documentation:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008

By default, it is not set to be ON. Please update the documentation to include the step to set it.
fields.summary: Update the 'JIRA 4.4 Upgrade Notes' (and possibly 'Connecting JIRA to SQL Server 2008') documentation with important information regarding JIRA installations connected to SQL Server databases.

fields.description:
If you have updated an user email address and you have a notification scheme set to send notifications based on project roles, the notifications will continue to be sent to the old email address.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Assign an existing user (email address *e.g. abc@atlassian.com*) to a project role;
# Create/Update/Edit an issue in order to fire an event to send a notification email to the user in the project role.
#* The user will receive the notification in his email (abc@atlassian.com).
# Change the user's email address to something else (*e.g. something@else.com*).
# Create/Update/Edit an issue in order to fire an event to send another notification email.
#* The email will be sent to the old email address (abc@atlassian.com) instead of the recently updated one (something@else.com).
fields.summary: Updates to User Email addresses will not take effect when attempting to send the emails based on project roles.
